issue.title: building from source error in under Ubuntu 12.04
building from source error in under Ubuntu 12.04

content.raw:
What flag did you set to false?

Can you post the full console output from a clean build?
~~~
cd gazebo
hg pull
hg up -C gazebo_2.2
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make
~~~

Also, what player packages do you have installed?
~~~
$ dpkg -l | grep libplayer
~~~
content.html:
What flag did you set to false?

Can you post the full console output from a clean build?

cd gazebo
hg pull
hg up -C gazebo_2.2
mkdir build
cd build
cmake ..
make

Also, what player packages do you have installed?

$ dpkg -l | grep libplayer

issue.title: building from source error in under Ubuntu 12.04

content.raw: Was that a clean build? Can you try removing the build folder and remaking it?
content.html: Was that a clean build? Can you try removing the build folder and remaking it?

issue.title: building from source error in under Ubuntu 12.04

content.raw: Ok it worked, I was cleaning the build with `make clean` which seems it didn't remove all the parts, after deleting the build it compiled. Thanks
content.html: Ok it worked, I was cleaning the build with make clean which seems it didn't remove all the parts, after deleting the build it compiled. Thanks

issue.title: building from source error in under Ubuntu 12.04

content.raw:
```make clean``` won't take care of rebuild the configuring information (it is only cleaning up the building parts), which is generated by ```cmake``` command. This is the reason why it was not fixing it for you.

I'm still interesting in knowing if you were able to build gazebo with player support from source.
content.html:
make clean won't take care of rebuild the configuring information (it is only cleaning up the building parts), which is generated by cmake command. This is the reason why it was not fixing it for you.

I'm still interesting in knowing if you were able to build gazebo with player support from source.

issue.title: building from source error in under Ubuntu 12.04

content.raw:
I think this is a bug in the debian packaging, not a bug in gazebo.  playerc++.pc explicitly requires on playerwkb.pc, playerinterface.pc, and playerc.pc.  When one of them is missing, the pkg-config call to libplayerc++ fails.  I think installing playerc++-dev should pull in those other three -dev packages to satisfy the pkgconfig requirements (and the build-time requirements).  

The fix in pull request #953 won't hurt anything, but it shouldn't be necessary.
content.html:
I think this is a bug in the debian packaging, not a bug in gazebo. playerc++.pc explicitly requires on playerwkb.pc, playerinterface.pc, and playerc.pc. When one of them is missing, the pkg-config call to libplayerc++ fails. I think installing playerc++-dev should pull in those other three -dev packages to satisfy the pkgconfig requirements (and the build-time requirements).

The fix in pull request #953 won't hurt anything, but it shouldn't be necessary.

issue.title: building from source error in under Ubuntu 12.04

content.raw:
I agree. I've [submitted the bug to debian](https://bugs.debian.org/cgi-bin/bugreport.cgi?bug=737929) while creating pull request 953 but won't have any luck yet.

BTW, in Debian/Ubuntu there is the good robot-player-dev which takes care of all the -dev jazz for you.
content.html:
I agree. I've submitted the bug to debian while creating pull request 953 but won't have any luck yet.

BTW, in Debian/Ubuntu there is the good robot-player-dev which takes care of all the -dev jazz for you.

issue.title: building from source error in under Ubuntu 12.04

content.raw:
I played with it a little more, it looks like the modversion and exists calls to pkgconfig all work when a Requires: is missing, but calls to cflags and libs don't.  I think that's why CMake says that Player was detected (it only checks for existance/version), but the CFLAGS aren't getting set (-I/usr/include/player-3.0 is needed to resolve libplayercore/playercore.h, and it comes from pkgconfig when the Requires are all present)

Edit: There is a bug against CMake for this behavior already:
http://public.kitware.com/Bug/view.php?id=14310
content.html:
I played with it a little more, it looks like the modversion and exists calls to pkgconfig all work when a Requires: is missing, but calls to cflags and libs don't. I think that's why CMake says that Player was detected (it only checks for existance/version), but the CFLAGS aren't getting set (-I/usr/include/player-3.0 is needed to resolve libplayercore/playercore.h, and it comes from pkgconfig when the Requires are all present)

Edit: There is a bug against CMake for this behavior already: http://public.kitware.com/Bug/view.php?id=14310

issue.title: building from source error in under Ubuntu 12.04

content.raw: I think this is resolved now; please reopen if not.
content.html: I think this is resolved now; please reopen if not.
